column1: Phenytoin is a medicine used to treat convulsions and seizures.

- Coma - Confusion - Convulsions (occasionally) - Dizziness - Fever - Low blood pressure - Rigidity - Sleepiness - Side-to-side eye movement (nystagmus) - Slurred speech - Swollen gums - Tremor (unintentional trembling) - Unsteadiness

The person may receive: - Activated charcoal - Airway support, including oxygen, breathing tube through the mouth (intubation),and ventilator (breathing machine) - Blood and urine tests - Chest x-ray - EKG (electrocardiogram, or heart tracing) - Fluids through the vein (intravenous or IV) - Laxative - Medicines to treat symptoms
